H0.text: Has an odor is the best way to find out whether a small, strange object observed on a field trip in a wooded area is a live animal.

H1.text: Has separate parts is the best way to determine whether a small, strange object seen on a field trip in a wooded area is a live animal.

H2.text: Can make a noise and has a lifelike color is the best way to determine whether the small, strange object seen on a field trip in a wooded area is a live animal.

H3.text: Carrying out basic life functions is the best way to find out whether a small, strange object seen on a field trip in a wooded area is a live animal.

A4.text: Life is defined descriptively by the capacity for homeostasis, organisation, metabolism, growth, adaptation, response to stimuli, and reproduction.

A5.text: Death is the termination of all vital functions or life processes in an organism or cell.
